00055 #define LLP_FUNCTION_MAX_LENGTH 16
00056 
00060 typedef struct {
00062         int size;
00064         char list[LLP_FUNCTION_LIST_SIZE][LLP_FUNCTION_MAX_LENGTH];

00352 typedef struct {
00354         int port;
00356         int min_connections;
00358         int max_connections;
00360         int cache_size;
00362         int expiration_time;
00364         char *static_nodes;
00366         char *recent_nodes;
00368         llp_function_list_t cipher_list;
00370         llp_function_list_t hash_list;
00372         llp_function_list_t mac_list;
00373 } llp_config_t;

00378 static const configoption_t options[] = {
00379         {PORT_KEYWORD, ARG_INT, handle_int, NULL, CTX_ALL},
00380         {MIN_CONNECTIONS_KEYWORD, ARG_INT, handle_int, NULL, CTX_ALL},
00381         {MAX_CONNECTIONS_KEYWORD, ARG_INT, handle_int, NULL, CTX_ALL},
00382         {CACHE_SIZE_KEYWORD, ARG_INT, handle_int, NULL, CTX_ALL},
00383         {EXPIRATION_TIME_KEYWORD, ARG_INT, handle_int, NULL, CTX_ALL},
00384         {STATIC_NODES_FILE_KEYWORD, ARG_STR, handle_file, NULL, CTX_ALL},
00385         {RECENT_NODES_FILE_KEYWORD, ARG_STR, handle_file, NULL, CTX_ALL},
00386         {CIPHER_LIST_KEYWORD, ARG_LIST, handle_ciphers, NULL, CTX_ALL},
00387         {HASH_LIST_KEYWORD, ARG_LIST, handle_hashes, NULL, CTX_ALL},
00388         {MAC_LIST_KEYWORD, ARG_LIST, handle_macs, NULL, CTX_ALL},
00389         LAST_OPTION
00390 };

00395 #define DEFAULT_CONFIG {                \
00396         DEFAULT_PORT,                           \
00397         DEFAULT_MIN_CONNECTIONS,        \
00398         DEFAULT_MAX_CONNECTIONS,        \
00399         DEFAULT_CACHE_SIZE,                     \
00400         DEFAULT_EXPIRATION_TIME,        \
00401         DEFAULT_STATIC_NODES,           \
00402         DEFAULT_RECENT_NODES,           \
00403         DEFAULT_CIPHER_LIST,            \
00404         DEFAULT_HASH_LIST,                      \
00405         DEFAULT_MAC_LIST                        \
00406 }

00411 static const llp_config_t default_config = DEFAULT_CONFIG;
00412 
00416 static llp_config_t current_config = DEFAULT_CONFIG;
00417 
00422 static char *cipher_string = NULL;
00423 static char *hash_string = NULL;
00424 static char *mac_string = NULL;
00427 /*============================================================================*/
00428 /* Public functions implementations.                                          */
00429 /*============================================================================*/
00430 
00431 int llp_configure(char *config_name) {
00432         configfile_t *config_file = NULL;
00433 
00434         if (config_name == NULL) {
00435                 liblog_warn(LAYER_LINK, "configuration file not sent by daemon," "using default llp.conf");
00436                 config_name = CONFIG_FILE_NAME;
00437         }
00438 
00439         config_file = dotconf_create(config_name, options, DOTCONF_NO_CONTEXT_CHECKING, DOTCONF_FLAGS);
00440 
00441         if (config_file == NULL) {
00442                 liblog_warn(LAYER_LINK, "can't find config file, using default parameters.");
00443         } else {
00444                 config_file->errorhandler = (dotconf_errorhandler_t) handle_error;
00445 
00446                 if (dotconf_command_loop(config_file) == 0) {
00447                         liblog_error(LAYER_LINK, "error parsing config_file.");
00448                 } else {
00449                         liblog_debug(LAYER_LINK, "configuration file parsed.");
00450                 }
00451                 dotconf_cleanup(config_file);
00452         }
00453 
00454         if (check_sanity() == CONFIG_NOT_SANE) {
00455                 liblog_warn(LAYER_LINK, "some parameters in configuration are not sane,"
00456                                 "using default values for them.");
00457         }
00458         liblog_debug(LAYER_LINK, "configuration file sanity checked.");
00459 
00460         /* Generating strings that specify supported functions. */
00461         cipher_string = get_function_string(&current_config.cipher_list);
00462         hash_string = get_function_string(&current_config.hash_list);
00463         mac_string = get_function_string(&current_config.mac_list);
00464 
00465         liblog_debug(LAYER_LINK, "cipher_string: %s.", cipher_string);
00466         liblog_debug(LAYER_LINK, "hash_string: %s.", hash_string);
00467         liblog_debug(LAYER_LINK, "mac_string: %s.", mac_string);
00468 
00469         if (cipher_string == NULL || hash_string == NULL || mac_string == NULL) {
00470                 liblog_fatal(LAYER_LINK, "error in malloc: %s.", strerror(errno));
00471                 return LLP_ERROR;
00472         }
00473 
00474         return LLP_OK;
00475 }
00476 
00477 /******************************************************************************/
00478 void llp_unconfigure() {
00479         memcpy(&current_config, &default_config, sizeof(llp_config_t));
00480 
00481         /* Freeing strings allocated on llp_configure(). */
00482         free(cipher_string);
00483         free(hash_string);
00484         free(mac_string);
00485 
00486         cipher_string = hash_string = mac_string = NULL;
00487 }
00488 
00489 /******************************************************************************/
00490 util_cipher_function_t *llp_search_cipher(char *ciphers) {
00491         int i;
00492         char *ciphers_copy;
00493         char *token;
00494         util_cipher_function_t *function;
00495 
00496         /* We duplicate the string, because strtok is destructive. */
00497         ciphers_copy = (char *)malloc(strlen(ciphers) + 1);
00498         if (ciphers_copy == NULL) {
00499                 liblog_fatal(LAYER_LINK, "error in malloc: %s.", strerror(errno));
00500                 return NULL;
00501         }
00502 
00503         memcpy(ciphers_copy, ciphers, strlen(ciphers) + 1);
00504 
00505         token = strtok((char *)ciphers_copy, ";");
00506         while (token != NULL) {
00507                 for (i = 0; i < current_config.cipher_list.size; i++) {
00508                         if (strcmp(token, current_config.cipher_list.list[i]) == 0) {
00509                                 function = util_get_cipher(token);
00510                                 free(ciphers_copy);
00511                                 return function;
00512                         }
00513                 }
00514                 token = strtok(NULL, ";");
00515         }
00516         free(ciphers_copy);
00517 
00518         liblog_error(LAYER_LINK, "no cipher algorithm negotiated: %s.", ciphers);
00519         return NULL;
00520 }
00521 
00522 /******************************************************************************/
00523 util_hash_function_t *llp_search_hash(char *hashes) {
00524         int i;
00525         char *hashes_copy;
00526         char *token;
00527         util_hash_function_t *function;
00528 
00529         /* We duplicate the string, because strtok is destructive. */
00530         hashes_copy = (char *)malloc(strlen(hashes) + 1);
00531         if (hashes_copy == NULL) {
00532                 liblog_fatal(LAYER_LINK, "error in malloc: %s.", strerror(errno));
00533                 return NULL;
00534         }
00535 
00536         memcpy(hashes_copy, hashes, strlen(hashes) + 1);
00537 
00538         token = strtok((char *)hashes_copy, ";");
00539         while (token != NULL) {
00540                 for (i = 0; i < current_config.hash_list.size; i++) {
00541                         if (strcmp(token, current_config.hash_list.list[i]) == 0) {
00542                                 function = util_get_hash(token);
00543                                 free(hashes_copy);
00544                                 return function;
00545                         }
00546                 }
00547                 token = strtok(NULL, ";");
00548         }
00549 
00550         free(hashes_copy);
00551 
00552         liblog_error(LAYER_LINK, "no hash algorithm negotiated: %s.", hashes);
00553         return NULL;
00554 }
00555 
00556 /******************************************************************************/
00557 util_mac_function_t *llp_search_mac(char *macs) {
00558         int i;
00559         char *macs_copy;
00560         char *token;
00561         util_mac_function_t *function;
00562 
00563         /* We duplicate the string, because strtok is destructive. */
00564         macs_copy = (char *)malloc(strlen(macs) + 1);
00565         if (macs_copy == NULL) {
00566                 liblog_fatal(LAYER_LINK, "error in malloc: %s.", strerror(errno));
00567                 return NULL;
00568         }
00569 
00570         memcpy(macs_copy, macs, strlen(macs) + 1);
00571 
00572         token = strtok((char *)macs_copy, ";");
00573         while (token != NULL) {
00574                 for (i = 0; i < current_config.mac_list.size; i++) {
00575                         if (strcmp(token, current_config.mac_list.list[i]) == 0) {
00576                                 function = util_get_mac(token);
00577                                 free(macs_copy);
00578                                 return function;
00579                         }
00580                 }
00581                 token = strtok(NULL, ";");
00582         }
00583 
00584         free(macs_copy);
00585 
00586         liblog_error(LAYER_LINK, "no MAC algorithm negotiated: %s.", macs);
00587         return NULL;
00588 }

00693 /******************************************************************************/
00694 DOTCONF_CB(handle_int) {
00695 
00696         if (strcmp(cmd->name, PORT_KEYWORD) == 0) {
00697                 liblog_debug(LAYER_LINK, "port parameter found.");
00698                 set_port(cmd->data.value);
00699                 return NULL;
00700         }
00701 
00702         if (strcmp(cmd->name, MIN_CONNECTIONS_KEYWORD) == 0) {
00703                 liblog_debug(LAYER_LINK, "min_connections parameter found.");
00704                 set_min_connections(cmd->data.value);
00705                 return NULL;
00706         }
00707 
00708         if (strcmp(cmd->name, MAX_CONNECTIONS_KEYWORD) == 0) {
00709                 liblog_debug(LAYER_LINK, "max_connections parameter found.");
00710                 set_max_connections(cmd->data.value);
00711                 return NULL;
00712         }
00713 
00714         if (strcmp(cmd->name, CACHE_SIZE_KEYWORD) == 0) {
00715                 liblog_debug(LAYER_LINK, "cache_size parameter found.");
00716                 set_cache_size(cmd->data.value);
00717                 return NULL;
00718         }
00719 
00720         if (strcmp(cmd->name, EXPIRATION_TIME_KEYWORD) == 0) {
00721                 liblog_debug(LAYER_LINK, "expiration_time parameter found.");
00722                 set_expiration_time(cmd->data.value);
00723                 return NULL;
00724         }
00725 
00726         return NULL;
00727 }
00728 
00729 /******************************************************************************/
00730 DOTCONF_CB(handle_file) {
00731         if (strcmp(cmd->name, RECENT_NODES_FILE_KEYWORD) == 0) {
00732                 liblog_debug(LAYER_DAEMON, "recent_nodes_file parameter found.");
00733                 set_recent_nodes_file(cmd->data.str);
00734                 return NULL;
00735         }
00736 
00737         if (strcmp(cmd->name, STATIC_NODES_FILE_KEYWORD) == 0) {
00738                 liblog_debug(LAYER_DAEMON, "recent_nodes_file parameter found.");
00739                 set_static_nodes_file(cmd->data.str);
00740                 return NULL;
00741         }
00742 
00743         return NULL;
00744 }
00745 
00746 /******************************************************************************/
00747 DOTCONF_CB(handle_ciphers) {
00748         int i;
00749         int size;
00750         llp_function_list_t list;
00751 
00752         /* Dotconf only uses 16 arguments in lists, leaving in cmd->data[15]
00753          * the unparsed rest of the string. So we use the first 15 arguments and 
00754          * ignore the rest of them. */
00755         if (cmd->arg_count == CFG_VALUES) {
00756                 liblog_warn(LAYER_LINK, "too much ciphers listed in"
00757                                 "configuration parameter, using the first 15 specified.");
00758                 size = cmd->arg_count - 1;
00759         } else {
00760                 size = cmd->arg_count;
00761         }
00762 
00763         /* Checking if functions specified are supported. */
00764         list.size = 0;
00765         for (i = 0; i < size; i++) {
00766                 if (util_get_cipher(cmd->data.list[i]) != NULL) {
00767                         strncpy(list.list[list.size++], cmd->data.list[i], LLP_FUNCTION_MAX_LENGTH);
00768                 }
00769         }
00770         /* Copying the default cipher. */
00771         if (list.size > 0) {
00772                 strncpy(list.list[list.size++], default_config.cipher_list.list[0],
00773                                 LLP_FUNCTION_MAX_LENGTH);
00774         }
00775         set_cipher_list(&list);
00776 
00777         return NULL;
00778 }
00779 
00780 /******************************************************************************/
00781 DOTCONF_CB(handle_hashes) {
00782         int i;
00783         int size;
00784         llp_function_list_t list;
00785 
00786         /* Dotconf only uses 16 arguments in lists, leaving in cmd->data[15]
00787          * the unparsed rest of the string. So we use the first 15 arguments and 
00788          * ignore the rest of them. */
00789         if (cmd->arg_count == CFG_VALUES) {
00790                 liblog_warn(LAYER_LINK, "too much hash functions listed in"
00791                                 "configuration parameter, using the first 15 specified.");
00792                 size = cmd->arg_count - 1;
00793         } else {
00794                 size = cmd->arg_count;
00795         }
00796 
00797         /* Checking if functions specified are supported. */
00798         list.size = 0;
00799         for (i = 0; i < size; i++) {
00800                 if (util_get_hash(cmd->data.list[i]) != NULL) {
00801                         strncpy(list.list[list.size++], cmd->data.list[i], LLP_FUNCTION_MAX_LENGTH);
00802                 }
00803         }
00804         /* Copying the default hash function. */
00805         if (list.size > 0) {
00806                 strncpy(list.list[list.size++], default_config.hash_list.list[0], LLP_FUNCTION_MAX_LENGTH);
00807         }
00808         set_hash_list(&list);
00809 
00810         return NULL;
00811 }
00812 
00813 /******************************************************************************/
00814 DOTCONF_CB(handle_macs) {
00815         int i;
00816         int size;
00817         llp_function_list_t list;
00818 
00819         /* Dotconf only uses 16 arguments in lists, leaving in cmd->data[15]
00820          * the unparsed rest of the string. So we use the first 15 arguments and 
00821          * ignore the rest of them. */
00822         if (cmd->arg_count == CFG_VALUES) {
00823                 liblog_warn(LAYER_LINK, "too much MAC functions listed in"
00824                                 "configuration parameter, using the first 15 specified.");
00825                 size = cmd->arg_count - 1;
00826         } else {
00827                 size = cmd->arg_count;
00828         }
00829 
00830         /* Checking if functions specified are supported. */
00831         list.size = 0;
00832         for (i = 0; i < size; i++) {
00833                 if (util_get_mac(cmd->data.list[i]) != NULL) {
00834                         strncpy(list.list[list.size++], cmd->data.list[i], LLP_FUNCTION_MAX_LENGTH);
00835                 }
00836         }
00837         /* Copying the default MAC function. */
00838         if (list.size > 0) {
00839                 strncpy(list.list[list.size++], default_config.mac_list.list[0], LLP_FUNCTION_MAX_LENGTH);
00840         }
00841         set_mac_list(&list);
00842 
00843         return NULL;
00844 }
00845 
00846 /******************************************************************************/
00847 FUNC_ERRORHANDLER(handle_error) {
00848 
00849         switch (dc_errno) {
00850 case ERR_PARSE_ERROR:
00851                         liblog_error(LAYER_LINK, "line %lu: parse error.", configfile->line);
00852                         break;
00853 case ERR_UNKNOWN_OPTION:
00854                         liblog_error(LAYER_LINK, "line %lu: unknown option.", configfile->line);
00855                         break;
00856 case ERR_WRONG_ARG_COUNT:
00857                         liblog_error(LAYER_LINK, "line %lu: wrong arguments count.", configfile->line);
00858                         break;
00859 case ERR_INCLUDE_ERROR:
00860                         liblog_error(LAYER_LINK, "line %lu: included file not found.", configfile->line);
00861                         break;
00862 case ERR_NOACCESS:
00863                         liblog_error(LAYER_LINK, "acess denied.");
00864                         break;
00865 default:
00866                         liblog_error(LAYER_LINK, "unknown error.");
00867         }
00868 
00869         llp_unconfigure();
00870         liblog_error(LAYER_LINK, "error in configuration file parsing, using defaults.");
00871 
00872         return 0;
00873 }
00874 
00875 /******************************************************************************/
00876 int check_sanity() {
00877         int return_value = CONFIG_SANE;
00878 
00879         if (current_config.port > MAX_PORT_NUMBER) {
00880                 liblog_error(LAYER_LINK, "invalid port.");
00881                 current_config.port = DEFAULT_PORT;
00882                 return_value = CONFIG_NOT_SANE;
00883         }
00884 
00885         if (current_config.min_connections <= 0) {
00886                 liblog_error(LAYER_LINK, "min_connections must be a positive integer.");
00887                 current_config.min_connections = DEFAULT_MIN_CONNECTIONS;
00888                 return_value = CONFIG_NOT_SANE;
00889         }
00890 
00891         if (current_config.max_connections <= 0 || current_config.max_connections >= 255) {
00892                 liblog_error(LAYER_LINK, "max_connections must be a positive integer between 1 and 255.");
00893                 current_config.max_connections = DEFAULT_MAX_CONNECTIONS;
00894                 return_value = CONFIG_NOT_SANE;
00895         }
00896 
00897         if (current_config.max_connections < current_config.min_connections) {
00898                 liblog_error(LAYER_LINK, "max connections must be greater than min_connections.");
00899                 current_config.min_connections = DEFAULT_MIN_CONNECTIONS;
00900                 current_config.max_connections = DEFAULT_MAX_CONNECTIONS;
00901                 return_value = CONFIG_NOT_SANE;
00902         }
00903 
00904         if (current_config.expiration_time <= ONE_MINUTE) {
00905                 liblog_error(LAYER_LINK, "session expiration time too small.");
00906                 current_config.expiration_time = DEFAULT_EXPIRATION_TIME;
00907                 return_value = CONFIG_NOT_SANE;
00908         }
00909 
00910         if (current_config.cache_size < 1) {
00911                 liblog_error(LAYER_LINK, "cache size too small.");
00912                 current_config.cache_size = DEFAULT_CACHE_SIZE;
00913                 return_value = CONFIG_NOT_SANE;
00914         }
00915 
00916         if (file_exists(current_config.recent_nodes) == FILE_NOT_PRESENT) {
00917                 liblog_error(LAYER_LINK, "file not found. (%s)", current_config.recent_nodes);
00918                 current_config.recent_nodes = DEFAULT_RECENT_NODES;
00919                 return_value = CONFIG_NOT_SANE;
00920         }
00921 
00922         if (file_exists(current_config.static_nodes) == FILE_NOT_PRESENT) {
00923                 liblog_error(LAYER_LINK, "file not found. (%s)", current_config.static_nodes);
00924                 current_config.static_nodes = DEFAULT_STATIC_NODES;
00925                 return_value = CONFIG_NOT_SANE;
00926         }
00927 
00928         if (current_config.cipher_list.size <= 0) {
00929                 liblog_error(LAYER_LINK, "cipher_list is invalid.");
00930                 memcpy(&current_config.cipher_list, &default_config.cipher_list,
00931                                 sizeof(llp_function_list_t));
00932                 return_value = CONFIG_NOT_SANE;
00933         }
00934 
00935         if (current_config.hash_list.size <= 0) {
00936                 liblog_error(LAYER_LINK, "hash_list is invalid.");
00937                 memcpy(&current_config.hash_list, &default_config.hash_list, sizeof(llp_function_list_t));
00938                 return_value = CONFIG_NOT_SANE;
00939         }
00940 
00941         if (current_config.mac_list.size <= 0) {
00942                 liblog_error(LAYER_LINK, "mac_list is invalid.");
00943                 memcpy(&current_config.mac_list, &default_config.mac_list, sizeof(llp_function_list_t));
00944                 return_value = CONFIG_NOT_SANE;
00945         }
00946 
00947         return return_value;
00948 }
00949 
00950 /******************************************************************************/
00951 void copy_removing_duplicates(llp_function_list_t * dst, llp_function_list_t * src) {
00952         int i, j;
00953         int found;
00954 
00955         dst->size = 0;
00956         for (i = 0; i < src->size; i++) {
00957                 found = 0;
00958                 for (j = 0; j < dst->size; j++)
00959                         if (strcmp(dst->list[j], src->list[i]) == 0) {
00960                                 found = 1;
00961                                 break;
00962                         }
00963                 if (!found) {
00964                         strncpy(dst->list[dst->size], src->list[i], LLP_FUNCTION_MAX_LENGTH);
00965                         (dst->size)++;
00966                 }
00967         }
00968 }
00969 
00970 /******************************************************************************/
00971 char *get_function_string(llp_function_list_t * function_list) {
00972         int i;
00973         int length;
00974         char *string;
00975 
00976         length = 0;
00977         for (i = 0; i < function_list->size; i++) {
00978                 length += strlen(function_list->list[i]);
00979         }
00980 
00981         /* Allocating string (length chars plus i ";" plus terminating \0). */
00982         string = (char *)malloc(length + i + 1);
00983         if (string == NULL) {
00984                 liblog_fatal(LAYER_LINK, "error in malloc: %s.", strerror(errno));
00985                 return NULL;
00986         }
00987 
00988         /* We start with the null string. */
00989         string[0] = '\0';
00990         for (i = 0; i < function_list->size; i++) {
00991                 length = strlen(function_list->list[i]);
00992                 strncat(string, function_list->list[i], length);
00993                 strncat(string, ";", 1);
00994         }
00995 
00996         return string;
00997 }
00998 
00999 /******************************************************************************/
01000 int copy_function_string(char *dst, int max, char *src) {
01001         int length;
01002         int i;
01003 
01004         length = strlen(src);
01005         /* If the string capacity is not enough, we truncate src to the last
01006          * function name. */
01007         if (length + 1 > max) {
01008                 liblog_warn(LAYER_LINK, "too much functions specified, truncating"
01009                                 "to last function identifier.");
01010                 for (i = max - 1; i > 0; i++) {
01011                         if (src[i] == ';') {
01012                                 length = i;
01013                                 break;
01014                         }
01015                 }
01016                 memcpy(dst, src, length);
01017                 dst[length] = '\0';
01018                 return LLP_ERROR;
01019         }
01020 
01021         memcpy(dst, src, length + 1);
01022 
01023         return length + 1;
01024 }
01025 
01026 /******************************************************************************/
01027 void replace_string(char **old, const char *new) {
01028         int length;
01029 
01030         if (*old != NULL) {
01031                 free(*old);
01032         }
01033         length = strlen(new);
01034         *old = malloc(length + 1);
01035         if (*old != NULL) {
01036                 strncpy(*old, new, length + 1);
01037         } else {
01038                 liblog_error(LAYER_LINK, "could not allocate memory for node_file"
01039                                 "parameter. Using NULL file.");
01040         }
01041 }
01042 
01043 /******************************************************************************/
01044 int file_exists(const char *filename) {
01045         int ret;
01046         FILE *file;
01047 
01048         file = fopen(filename, "r");
01049         if (file == NULL) {
01050                 ret = FILE_NOT_PRESENT;
01051         } else {
01052                 ret = FILE_PRESENT;
01053                 fclose(file);
01054         }
01055 
01056         return ret;
01057 }
